markdown:
**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0 **Usage** etched onto a weapon --- Magical enhancements make this weapon strike true. Attack rolls with this weapon gain a +1 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with one property rune.
You can upgrade the _weapon potency_ rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. The Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' prices. Weapon Potency (+1) **Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 4.0 **Price** 35 gp **Craft Requirements** You are an expert in Crafting. Weapon Potency (+2) **Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 4.0 **Price** 935 gp --- The item bonus to attack rolls is +2, and the weapon can be etched with two property runes. **Craft Requirements** You are a master in Crafting. Weapon Potency (+3) **Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 4.0 **Price** 8,935 gp --- The item bonus to attack rolls is +3, and the weapon can be etched with three property runes. **Craft Requirements** You are legendary in Crafting.
name: Weapon Potency (+1)

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 3+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Preserving](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2302)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 144 <sup>1.1</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** applied to a basket, bag, or other container

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

_Preserving_ runes are common among merchants and other travelers who are on the road for weeks or months at a time. Any non-magical food and drink inside a container with a _preserving_ rune remains fresher for longer, taking ten times as long to spoil. This feature doesn't prolong the duration of alchemical items.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

---

Non-magical food and drink inside the container never spoil, and the rune has an activation.

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> command, Interact;  **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** The container casts [_purify food and drink_](/Spells.aspx?ID=241) on all the food and drink within.
name: Preserving

markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 3"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Authorized](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1864)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 32 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Price** 50 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Sharp needles impale anyone who attempts to wield this weapon other than its rightful owner. Each _authorized_ rune is etched with the blood of a specific creature. If any other creature wields the weapon, needles immediately erupt from the weapon's hilt or shaft, dealing 1d8 piercing damage plus 1d4 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) to the wielder. If the weapon has a _[striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280)_ rune, this damage increases to 1d8 per damage die and 1d4 persistent damage per damage die; this counts only the weapon's base die and dice from the _striking_ rune. The persistent bleed damage can't end while the creature still holds the weapon. The spikes retract once the creature lets go.

 When the rune is crafted, the crafter can choose to broaden the criteria for who can safely wield the item, expanding the users to creatures with a particular alignment, bloodline, or patron deity, as the crafter chooses. This criterion must be shared by the creature who contributed the blood for the rune.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Authorized

Common among brutes who use the magic to scare others into compliance, _menacing_ runes lend you a formidable appearance, granting you a +1 item bonus to [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) checks to [Coerce](/Actions.aspx?ID=52) others.

[Underwater](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2634)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Water" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=165" />

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This weapon works as well in water as it does on land. Attacks with the weapon don't take the normal penalties and restrictions for being used in water or underwater. If the weapon is capable of dealing fire damage, its fire functions underwater as well.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<traits>

</row>

</column>

---

When you make a thrown Strike with this weapon, it flies back to your hand after the Strike is complete. If your hands are full when the weapon returns, it falls to the ground in your space.

markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Merciful](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1869)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 33 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Price** 70 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

_Merciful_ weapons are sheathed in an unmistakable wispy green aura recognized by both gladiators and guards around the world. A merciful weapon has the [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188) trait and can't be used to make a lethal attack. Any [persistent damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) the weapon would deal is negated.

 On a critical hit, a _merciful_ weapon causes the target to become [fascinated](/Conditions.aspx?ID=14) with the weapon's wielder for 1 minute, as the target is bombarded with feelings of guilt and remorse. This is a [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106) effect. If you have access to the weapon's [critical specialization effect](/Rules.aspx?ID=235), you choose whether to use it or the merciful effect.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Merciful

<title

    right="Item 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Ghost Touch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2840)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 238 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 75 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A weapon etched with this rune can harm creatures without physical form. A _ghost touch_ weapon is particularly effective against [incorporeal](/Traits.aspx?ID=222) creatures, which almost always have a specific vulnerability to ghost touch weapons. Incorporeal creatures can touch, hold, and wield ghost touch weapons (unlike most physical objects).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 5"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Assisting](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1829)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 12 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Price** 125 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Your armor provides support for your joints or advanced prostheses for missing limbs, holding your body in place and easing physical symptoms. This replicates the benefits of any number of [splints, supports, and prostheses](/Rules.aspx?ID=1664). When you invest the armor, you determine how many such supports you want, and where on your body they assist you.

 In addition, the extra support and structure provided by the armor allows you to transport more than you would otherwise normally be able to. You can carry Bulk equal to 6 + your Strength modifier before becoming encumbered, and you can hold and carry a total Bulk of up to 11 + your Strength modifier.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Price** 125 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A weapon with this rune hums when touched to the ground.

**Activate** <actions string="Reaction" /> command;  **Frequency** once per hour;  **Requirements** You critically hit a flying creature with the etched weapon; **Effect** The rune casts a DC 20 [_earthbind_](/Spells.aspx?ID=94) spell on the flying creature.

</title>

<traits>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

---

This armor can be disguised with a mere thought. 

**Activate—Costume Change** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32))    **Effect** You change the shape and appearance of this armor to appear as ordinary or fine clothes of your imagining. The armor’s statistics don’t change. Only a creature that’s benefiting from _truesight_ or a similar effect can attempt to disbelieve this illusion, with a DC of 25.

    level="1"
    right="Item 5"
    pfs="Restricted"
>
[Pacifying](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1870)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Enchantment" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=61" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 33 <sup>1.1</sup>, [Pathfinder #157: Devil at the Dreaming Palace](/Sources.aspx?ID=45) pg. 78

**Price** 150 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This rune turns weapons into instruments of peacemaking.

**Activate** <actions string="Reaction" /> command ([mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106))  **Trigger** You damage a creature with the etched weapon;  **Effect** The damaged creature must succeed at a DC 20 Will save or be pacified. A pacified creature takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls on any attacks that aren't [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188) for 1 minute, and the creature also experiences a clear psychic warning that they should stop making attacks that could kill.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

</title>

<traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 226 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

---

A _ready_ rune draws component pieces of a suit of armor toward one another, making it extremely fast to get into. You can don light armor with a ready rune as a single action, or medium or heavy armor with a ready rune as a 2-action activity.

markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 6+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Swallow-Spike](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1838)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 13 <sup>1.1</sup>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) Attacks made by armor with the swallow-spike rune apply the Multiple Attack Penalty as if you had made them with another weapon._

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Your armor responds to your desire to break free of a creature grabbing you by growing spikes.

**Activate** <actions string="Reaction" /> envision ([attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15))  **Trigger** You become [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20), [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33), or otherwise held immobilized in a creature's grasp, such as by being [engulfed](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=14) or [swallowed](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=35);  **Effect** Your armor suddenly grows spikes, attacking the triggering creature. The armor makes a melee attack with an attack modifier of +14 that deals 2d6 piercing damage. If the creature is swallowing or engulfing you, the attack deals an additional 1d6 damage, and damage from this attack can cut you free if it equals or exceeds the Rupture value of the immobilizing ability. This attack gets an item bonus to the attack roll equal to the armor's item bonus to your AC and an item bonus to damage equal to double that amount.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> envision ([attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15))   **Requirements** You're being held immobilized as described in the rune's other activation; **Effect** Your armor attacks the creature immobilizing you. The armor makes a melee attack against the creature, as described in the rune's other activation.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

markdown:
**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 238 2.0 **Price** 225 gp **Usage** etched onto a melee weapon --- With a moment of manipulation, you can shift this weapon into a different weapon with a similar form. **Activate—Shift Weapon** ([manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) **Effect** The weapon takes the shape of another melee weapon that requires the same number of hands to wield. The weapon's runes and any precious material it's made of apply to the weapon's new shape. Any property runes that can't apply to the new form are suppressed until the item takes a shape to which they can apply.
The weapons a _shifting_ weapon can turn into are based on the base attributes of the weapon, so reference the weapon's Hands entry in the weapons table to see what it can turn into. For example, a bastard sword requires one hand, even though it gets a benefit in two hands from the two-hand trait. Therefore, a _shifting bastard sword_ could turn into a longsword, but not a greatsword. Activating this rune doesn't change how many hands you're currently using to hold the weapon.
name: Shifting

</title>

<traits>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

---

_Trackless_ runes are common among hunters and trappers, as well as thieves and anyone fleeing pursuit. While wearing _trackless_ footwear, you have a +4 item bonus to the DC to track you. However, this bonus doesn't stack with the status bonus from [_pass without trace_](/Spells.aspx?ID=215).

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 6"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Flickering](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3447)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Seven Dooms for Sandpoint</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #200: Seven Dooms for Sandpoint](/Sources.aspx?ID=229) pg. 182

**Price** 250 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A _flickering_ rune causes a weapon to shimmer, grow blurry and indistinct, and momentarily turn invisible at random intervals for a second or two. A _flickering_ weapon adds its item bonus from its potency rune to the DC against attempts to [Disarm](/Actions.aspx?ID=2383) or [Steal](/Actions.aspx?ID=2410) it. On a critical hit, the weapon flashes bright pulses of color into the creature's eyes, [dazzling](/Conditions.aspx?ID=65) the creature for 1 round (this effect has the [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=727) trait). 

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> envision, command;  **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** The flickering weapon casts [_blur_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1455) to your specification.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Flickering
primary_source_raw: Pathfinder #200: Seven Dooms for Sandpoint pg. 182

<traits>

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Shields with a _retaliation_ rune use the impact of weapons to generate blasts of explosive force that counterattack foes.

**Activate** <actions string="Free Action" /> envision;  **Frequency** once per hour; **Trigger** You [Shield Block](/Feats.aspx?ID=839) a melee Strike;  **Effect** You unleash force damage against the creature that made the triggering attack. This attack deals 4d4 force damage (DC 20 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save).

This armor can make itself and its wearer quickly change size.

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 7"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Flurrying](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1867)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 33 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Price** 360 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a melee weapon with the  monk  trait

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

When you make a [Flurry of Blows](/Actions.aspx?ID=9) using the etched weapon and your first Strike reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points, you can make your second Strike with an echo of the weapon, increasing the reach to 30 feet.

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> command, envision ([evocation](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1671), [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=75)) **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** The weapon casts a [_spiritual weapon_](/Spells.aspx?ID=306) spell. The ghostly weapon looks like the etched weapon. Use your normal attack bonus and damage for the weapon instead of the damage listed in the spell, but use your Wisdom modifier instead of Strength when determining damage. You can choose to make a Flurry of Blows instead of a Strike when the _spiritual weapon_ attacks; this still counts as your [flourish](/Traits.aspx?ID=73) for the turn. You can Sustain this activation in the same manner as the spell.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Flurrying

---

Small roots grow along the surface of the weapon, clinging tightly to its contours. On a critical hit with the weapon, roots grow from the target. It's [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24) for 1 round ([Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) DC 23) and [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3) for as long as the immobilization lasts.

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 8+"
    pfs=""
>
[Energy-Resistant](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2788)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 226 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

These symbols convey protective forces from the Elemental Planes. You gain resistance 5 to [acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3), [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27), [electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56), or [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72). The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the rune. Multiple energy-resistant runes can be etched onto a suit of armor; rather than using only the strongest effect, each must provide resistance to a different damage type. For instance, a _+2 acid-resistant greater fire-resistant breastplate_ would give you acid resistance 5 and fire resistance 10.

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 8"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Catching](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2299)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 144 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Price** 425 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** applied to shield

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A _catching_ rune creates a small, magical vacuum that attempts to pull weapons away from opponents. If you can attempt to [Disarm](/Actions.aspx?ID=41) as part of a [Shield Block](/Feats.aspx?ID=839), such as with the [Disarming Block](/Feats.aspx?ID=1896) feat or this rune's activated ability, a catching shield grants you a +1 circumstance bonus to such Disarm attempts.

**Activate** <actions string="Free Action" /> envision;  **Frequency** once per hour; **Trigger** You Shield Block a melee Strike made with a held weapon;  **Effect** You attempt to Disarm the creature whose attack you blocked of the weapon they attacked you with. You can do so even if you don't have a hand free.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Catching

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 8+"
    pfs=""
>
[Astral](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2832)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
<trait label="Spirit" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=149" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

_Astral_ weapons command powerful spiritual energy from the Astral Plane. This rune has the same effects as a [ghost touch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=297) rune, plus Strikes with it deal an extra 1d6 spirit damage. If used to attack a creature that's possessing another creature, this weapon deals no damage to the possessed creature. On a critical hit against a creature possessing another creature, the possessing creature must succeed at a DC 26 Will save or be expelled and unable to possess a creature for 1d4 rounds.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 8"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Gliding](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1831)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 12 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Price** 450 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

The armor allows you to make a controlled descent.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> command;     **Effect** You glide slowly toward the ground, 5 feet down and up to 25 feet forward through the air. Provided you spend at least 1 action gliding on your turn and haven't yet reached the ground, you remain in the air at the end of your turn. Otherwise, you fall.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Gliding

    pfs="Standard"

[Preserving](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2302)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 144 <sup>1.1</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** applied to a basket, bag, or other container

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

_Preserving_ runes are common among merchants and other travelers who are on the road for weeks or months at a time. Any non-magical food and drink inside a container with a _preserving_ rune remains fresher for longer, taking ten times as long to spoil. This feature doesn't prolong the duration of alchemical items.

</column>

</title>

<traits>

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Acid sizzles across the surface of the weapon etched with this rune. When you hit with the weapon, add 1d6 acid damage to the damage dealt. In addition, on a critical hit, the target's armor (if any) takes 3d6 acid damage (before applying Hardness); if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes this damage instead.

<title

[Decaying](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2835)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Acid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=524" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
<trait label="Void" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=510" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 237 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Eerie waves of purplish energy dance across the surface of a weapon etched with this rune. When you hit with the weapon, add 1d4 void damage to the damage dealt. In addition, on a critical hit, the target takes 2d4 [persistent void damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29); if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes the same amount of persistent damage (its wielder rolls the flat check to see if the persistent damage ends, or the GM rolls if the shield is no longer in someone's possession). Unlike normal void damage, the void damage from a decaying rune damages objects, constructs, and the like by eroding them away.

</column>

text: <title level="1" right="Item 8+" pfs="" > Decaying Source GM Core pg. 237 2.0 Usage etched onto a weapon --- Eerie waves of purplish energy dance across the surface of a weapon etched with this rune. When you hit with the weapon, add 1d4 void damage to the damage dealt. In addition, on a critical hit, the target takes 2d4 persistent void damage; if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes the same amount of persistent damage (its wielder rolls the flat check to see if the persistent damage ends, or the GM rolls if the shield is no longer in someone's possession). Unlike normal void damage, the void damage from a decaying rune damages objects, constructs, and the like by eroding them away. <title level="2" right="Item 8" pfs="Standard" > Decaying Source GM Core pg. 237 2.0 Price 500 gp <title level="2" right="Item 15" pfs="Standard" > Decaying (Greater) Source GM Core pg. 237 2.0 Price 6,500 gp --- The void damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target's void resistance or immunity. Increase the persistent void damage dealt on a critical hit to 4d4.
description:
Eerie waves of purplish energy dance across the surface of a weapon etched with this rune. When you hit with the weapon, add 1d4 void damage to the damage dealt. In addition, on a critical hit, the target takes 2d4 [persistent void damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29); if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes the same amount of persistent damage (its wielder rolls the flat check to see if the persistent damage ends, or the GM rolls if the shield is no longer in someone's possession). Unlike normal void damage, the void damage from a decaying rune damages objects, constructs, and the like by eroding them away.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

A _thundering_ weapon lets out a peal of thunder when it hits, dealing an extra 1d6 sonic damage on a successful Strike. On a critical hit, the target must succeed at a DC 24 Fortitude save or be deafened for 1 minute (or 1 hour on a critical failure).

markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 9"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Nightmare](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3453)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Seven Dooms for Sandpoint</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Enchantment" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=61" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #200: Seven Dooms for Sandpoint](/Sources.aspx?ID=229) pg. 185

**Price** 250 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A _nightmare_ rune creates minor phantasmal alterations to a weapon's appearance so that those who look upon it see subtle reminders of their deepest fears. An arachnophobe might interpret the cross guard of a _nightmare_ longsword to look like curving, twitching spider legs, for example, while someone who's afraid of sickness might see a _nightmare_ club as a diseased length of bone crawling with flies. These images are all in the mind of the observer, but they also infuse the weapon with additional power. When you hit with a nightmare weapon, add 1d6 mental damage to the damage dealt. In addition, on a critical hit, the target becomes [stupefied](/Conditions.aspx?ID=94) 1 by overwhelming visions in their mind of personal horrors that linger. If you critically hit a creature that's already stupefied, it becomes [frightened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=76) 2 as well. These critical hit effects have the [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=598), and [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647) traits.

[Advancing](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1827)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 12 <sup>1.1</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto heavy armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This rune charges up as you defeat your foes, driving you forward across the battlefield with every victory.

**Activate** <actions string="Free Action" /> command;    **Requirements** Your last action or activity reduced an enemy to 0 Hit Points; **Effect** You Stride up to 15 feet. This movement doesn't trigger reactions. You can [Burrow](/Actions.aspx?ID=93), [Climb](/Actions.aspx?ID=33), [Fly](/Actions.aspx?ID=94), or [Swim](/Actions.aspx?ID=39) instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

</column>

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 9"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Malleable](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2614)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Metal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=505" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 146 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 650 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a metal medium or heavy armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

The metal of your armor can shift and rearrange at a moment's notice, allowing you to manipulate what kind of damage it resists.

**Activate—Reconfigure Armor** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104))    **Effect** The armor's composition shifts, changing its [specialization](/Rules.aspx?ID=211) group to a different one of your choice. This doesn't change what the armor is made of, and any runes or precious material it's made of apply to the new composition. Any property runes that can't apply to the new form are suppressed until the item takes a composition to which they can apply.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

    pfs="Standard"

[Pontoon](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2301)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 144 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Price** 650 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** applied to footwear

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Footwear with _pontoon_ runes allows you to traverse waterways with ease. While wearing footwear with the rune, you can walk on the surface of water and other liquids without falling through. This offers no protection against damage the liquid deals. You can go under the liquid's surface, but you must [Swim](/Actions.aspx?ID=39) if you do.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 9"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Portable](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1835)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 13 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Price** 660 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This rune allows your armor to collapse into a disguised, portable form.

**Activate** <actions string="Three Actions" /> command, envision, Interact;     **Effect** You doff your armor, which folds into another wearable object, such as a bangle or amulet with light Bulk. This wearable object has features that hint at the armor it hides. You aren't wearing the armor while it's in this form, but at the GM's discretion, you can still activate properties that might feasibly come from the wearable item the armor has become. If the armor is in its portable form, you can use this activation to revert it to armor, which you can don in 1 minute.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 9"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Coating](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1865)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Extradimensional" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=67" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 32 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Price** 700 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

When etched, this rune creates an extradimensional space that links to the weapon that wields it. The space can hold up to 1 Bulk but can contain only [poisons](/Equipment.aspx?Category=6&Subcategory=9) and [magic oils](/Equipment.aspx?Category=15&Subcategory=17) that could be applied to the weapon. Stowing or retrieving an item in the space requires an Interact action, except when using the rune's activation.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> command;    **Requirements** At least one magic oil or poison is stored inside the rune's extradimensional space; **Effect** For 1 minute, you can apply stored oils and poisons to the weapon without needing any hands free. Applying them takes the same number of actions as normal. An oil or poison applied this way pours directly from the extradimensional space onto the weapon, and when it's fully applied, its empty vial is ejected.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Coating
search_markdown:
<traits>

text: <title level="1" right="Item 9" pfs="Standard" > Coating Source Treasure Vault pg. 32 1.1 Price 700 gp Usage etched onto a weapon --- When etched, this rune creates an extradimensional space that links to the weapon that wields it. The space can hold up to 1 Bulk but can contain only poisons and magic oils that could be applied to the weapon. Stowing or retrieving an item in the space requires an Interact action, except when using the rune's activation. Activate Single Action command; Requirements At least one magic oil or poison is stored inside the rune's extradimensional space; Effect For 1 minute, you can apply stored oils and poisons to the weapon without needing any hands free. Applying them takes the same number of actions as normal. An oil or poison applied this way pours directly from the extradimensional space onto the weapon, and when it's fully applied, its empty vial is ejected.
description:
When etched, this rune creates an extradimensional space that links to the weapon that wields it. The space can hold up to 1 Bulk but can contain only [poisons](/Equipment.aspx?Category=6&Subcategory=9) and [magic oils](/Equipment.aspx?Category=15&Subcategory=17) that could be applied to the weapon. Stowing or retrieving an item in the space requires an Interact action, except when using the rune's activation.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> command;    **Requirements** At least one magic oil or poison is stored inside the rune's extradimensional space; **Effect** For 1 minute, you can apply stored oils and poisons to the weapon without needing any hands free. Applying them takes the same number of actions as normal. An oil or poison applied this way pours directly from the extradimensional space onto the weapon, and when it's fully applied, its empty vial is ejected.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

An extending rune allows you to extend your weapon to impossible lengths. 

**Activate—Extend** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104))    **Effect** You extend your weapon, giving you an impossible reach. You Strike with the weapon, and you have reach 60 feet for the Strike.

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 238 2.0 **Price** 700 gp **Usage** etched onto a weapon --- When your attack roll with this weapon is a critical hit and gains the critical specialization effect, you gain an additional benefit depending on the weapon group. **[Axe](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=1)** You can damage a third creature, with the same restrictions.
**[Bow](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=3)** The Athletics check to pull the missile free is DC 20.
**[Brawling](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=4)** The target takes a –4 circumstance penalty to its save.
**[Club](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=5)** You can knock the target up to 15 feet away.
**[Crossbow](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=17)** If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile, as the [bow](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=3) critical specialization.
**[Dart](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=6)** The base persistent bleed damage increases to 2d6.
**[Firearm](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=16)** The target takes a –4 circumstance penalty to its save.
**[Flail](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=7)** You move the target 5 feet. You can't move it away from you, but you can move it in another direction of your choice.
**[Hammer](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=8)** You can also knock the target 5 feet away from you.
**[Knife](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=9)** The target takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speed while it has the persistent bleed damage.
**[Pick](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=10)** The extra damage from the critical specialization effect increases to 4 per weapon damage die.
**[Polearm](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=11)** You can move the target up to 10 feet.
**[Shield](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=12)** You can knock the target up to 10 feet away.
**[Sling](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=13)** The target also takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speed for 1 round if it fails the save.
**[Spear](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=14)** The [clumsy](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3) condition lasts for 2 rounds.
**[Sword](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=15)** The target is off-guard until the end of your next turn.
name: Grievous

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 9"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Swarming](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1871)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 33 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Price** 700 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a  thrown  weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Able to copy itself many times over when thrown until the air is filled with deadly blades, a swarming weapon turns a single weapon into a shower of devastation.

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> command, envision;  **Frequency** once per hour;   **Effect** You fling your weapon and it multiplies as it flies through the air, filling a 30-foot cone. All creatures within the area take damage equal to double the weapon's number of damage dice, with a DC 27 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Swarming

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 10"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Magnetizing](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1833)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 13 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Price** 900 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto metal armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This rune alters the magnetic polarity of your armor, making other metal items drawn to it ever so slightly. You can amplify the magnetic power of the armor to keep another creature from getting away from you.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> command;  **Frequency** once per hour;  **Requirements** A creature adjacent to you is made of metal or wearing metal armor; **Effect** You magnetize your armor. If you or the target attempt to move away from one another, treat each square as difficult terrain. This doesn't affect movement that keeps you the same distance from one another, so you could still Step if you remained adjacent to the target. This effect ends once either of you is no longer adjacent to the other at the end of an action.

 This Activation might work on some creatures partially made of metal, such as those with metal scales, as determined by the GM. Likewise, the GM might determine some metal creatures are non-magnetic, depending on the metal they're made of.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Magnetizing

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 6+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Trackless](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2304)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 145 <sup>1.1</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** applied to footwear

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

_Trackless_ runes are common among hunters and trappers, as well as thieves and anyone fleeing pursuit. While wearing _trackless_ footwear, you have a +4 item bonus to the DC to track you. However, this bonus doesn't stack with the status bonus from [_pass without trace_](/Spells.aspx?ID=215).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

**Price** 900 gp

</row>

</column>

---

The rune has an activation.

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> command, envision;  **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** You extend the effect of your rune out to a 20-foot emanation. The emanation remains for 8 hours, affecting up to 10 creatures of your choice within the area. You can Dismiss this effect.
name: Trackless (Greater)

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0 **Usage** etched onto a weapon --- Magical enhancements make this weapon strike true. Attack rolls with this weapon gain a +1 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with one property rune.
You can upgrade the _weapon potency_ rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. The Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' prices. Weapon Potency (+1) **Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 4.0 **Price** 35 gp **Craft Requirements** You are an expert in Crafting. Weapon Potency (+2) **Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 4.0 **Price** 935 gp --- The item bonus to attack rolls is +2, and the weapon can be etched with two property runes. **Craft Requirements** You are a master in Crafting. Weapon Potency (+3) **Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 4.0 **Price** 8,935 gp --- The item bonus to attack rolls is +3, and the weapon can be etched with three property runes. **Craft Requirements** You are legendary in Crafting.
name: Weapon Potency (+2)

[Retaliation](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2303)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 144 <sup>1.1</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** applied to shield

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Shields with a _retaliation_ rune use the impact of weapons to generate blasts of explosive force that counterattack foes.

**Activate** <actions string="Free Action" /> envision;  **Frequency** once per hour; **Trigger** You [Shield Block](/Feats.aspx?ID=839) a melee Strike;  **Effect** You unleash force damage against the creature that made the triggering attack. This attack deals 4d4 force damage (DC 20 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save).

</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 226 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Magic wards deflect attacks. Increase the armor's item bonus to AC by 1. The armor can be etched with one property rune.

 You can upgrade the _armor potency rune_ already etched on a suit of armor using the normal process for [upgrading items and runes](/Rules.aspx?ID=3157).

</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 226 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A _ready_ rune draws component pieces of a suit of armor toward one another, making it extremely fast to get into. You can don light armor with a ready rune as a single action, or medium or heavy armor with a ready rune as a 2-action activity.

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 11"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Holy](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2842)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Holy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=517" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 238 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 1,400 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon that isn't unholy

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A _holy_ weapon commands powerful celestial energy. Strikes made with it gain the holy trait and deal an extra 1d4 spirit damage, or an extra 2d4 against an unholy target. If you are unholy, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon. 

**Activate—Holy Healing** <actions string="Reaction" /> [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=89), [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509) **Frequency** once per day; **Trigger** You critically succeed at a Strike against an unholy creature with the weapon;  **Effect** You regain HP equal to double the unholy creature's level

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Holy

<traits>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

---

Small roots grow along the surface of the weapon, clinging tightly to its contours. On a critical hit with the weapon, roots grow from the target. It's [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24) for 1 round ([Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) DC 23) and [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3) for as long as the immobilization lasts.

Small roots grow along the surface of the weapon, clinging tightly to its contours. On a critical hit with the weapon, roots grow from the target. It's [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24) for 1 round ([Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) DC 23) and [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3) for as long as the immobilization lasts.

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 11"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Unholy](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2851)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
<trait label="Unholy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=521" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 239 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 1,400 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched into a weapon that isn't holy

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

An unholy rune instills fiendish power into the etched weapon. Strikes made with it gain the unholy trait and deal an extra 1d4 spirit damage, or an extra 2d4 against a holy target. If you are holy, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon.

**Activate—Unholy Bloodshed** <actions string="Reaction" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32)) **Frequency** once per day; **Trigger** You critically succeed at an attack
roll against a holy creature with the weapon;  **Effect** The target takes persistent bleed damage equal to 1d8 per weapon damage die of the etched weapon.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Unholy

markdown:
**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0 **Usage** etched onto a weapon --- A _striking rune_ stores destructive magic in the weapon, increasing the weapon damage dice it deals to two instead of one. For instance, a _+1 striking [dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3)_ would deal 2d4 damage instead of 1d4 damage.
You can upgrade the _striking rune_ already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. The Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices. Striking **Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 4.0 **Price** 65 gp Striking (Greater) **Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 4.0 **Price** 1,065 gp --- The weapon deals three weapon damage dice. Striking (Major) **Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 4.0 **Price** 31,065 gp --- The weapon deals four weapon damage dice.
name: Striking (Greater)

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 8+"
    pfs=""
>
[Energy-Resistant](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2788)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 226 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

These symbols convey protective forces from the Elemental Planes. You gain resistance 5 to [acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3), [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27), [electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56), or [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72). The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the rune. Multiple energy-resistant runes can be etched onto a suit of armor; rather than using only the strongest effect, each must provide resistance to a different damage type. For instance, a _+2 acid-resistant greater fire-resistant breastplate_ would give you acid resistance 5 and fire resistance 10.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 6+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Swallow-Spike](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1838)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 13 <sup>1.1</sup>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) Attacks made by armor with the swallow-spike rune apply the Multiple Attack Penalty as if you had made them with another weapon._

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Your armor responds to your desire to break free of a creature grabbing you by growing spikes.

**Activate** <actions string="Reaction" /> envision ([attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15))  **Trigger** You become [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20), [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33), or otherwise held immobilized in a creature's grasp, such as by being [engulfed](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=14) or [swallowed](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=35);  **Effect** Your armor suddenly grows spikes, attacking the triggering creature. The armor makes a melee attack with an attack modifier of +14 that deals 2d6 piercing damage. If the creature is swallowing or engulfing you, the attack deals an additional 1d6 damage, and damage from this attack can cut you free if it equals or exceeds the Rupture value of the immobilizing ability. This attack gets an item bonus to the attack roll equal to the armor's item bonus to your AC and an item bonus to damage equal to double that amount.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> envision ([attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15))   **Requirements** You're being held immobilized as described in the rune's other activation; **Effect** Your armor attacks the creature immobilizing you. The armor makes a melee attack against the creature, as described in the rune's other activation.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

</traits>

The attack modifier increases to +22, the damage increases to 3d6, and the extra damage to an engulfing or swallowing creature increases to 2d6.

level="2"

>
Swallow-Spike (Major)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

The attack modifier increases to +28, the damage increases to 5d6, and the extra damage to an engulfing or swallowing creature increases to 3d6.

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 12"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Immovable](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1832)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 12 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Price** 1,800 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This rune utilizes magical principles used in an [_immovable rod_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=259).

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> Interact;  **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** Your armor anchors you in place, even defying gravity, rendering you [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24) until you Dismiss the Activation. while you're immobilized in this way, you can be moved only if a creature succeeds at a DC 40 [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check to [Force Open](/Actions.aspx?ID=34) your armor. You can also be moved if 8,000 pounds of pressure are placed upon you, though this is likely fatal.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Immovable

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> Interact;  **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** Your armor anchors you in place, even defying gravity, rendering you [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24) until you Dismiss the Activation. while you're immobilized in this way, you can be moved only if a creature succeeds at a DC 40 [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check to [Force Open](/Actions.aspx?ID=34) your armor. You can also be moved if 8,000 pounds of pressure are placed upon you, though this is likely fatal.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
search_text: <title level="1" right="item 12" pfs="standard" > immovable source treasure vault pg. 12 1.1 price 1,800 gp usage etched onto armor --- this rune utilizes magical principles used in an immovable rod . activate single action interact; frequency once per day; effect your armor anchors you in place, even defying gravity, rendering you immobilized until you dismiss the activation. while you're immobilized in this way, you can be moved only if a creature succeeds at a dc 40 athletics check to force open your armor. you can also be moved if 8,000 pounds of pressure are placed upon you, though this is likely fatal.

markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 12+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Brilliant](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2833)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This rune causes a weapon to transform into pure, brilliant energy. The weapon deals an additional 1d4 fire damage on a successful Strike, as well as 1d4 spirit damage to fiends and 1d4 vitality damage to undead. On a critical hit, the target must succeed at a DC 29 Fortitude save or be blinded for 1 round. 

**Activate—Shine Bright** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100))    **Effect** You plunge your weapon into darkness to return the light. Attempt a counteract check with a counteract rank of 5 and a +19 counteract modifier to end a magical darkness effect whose area is within reach of the weapon.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

[Fortification](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2789)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 226 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto medium or heavy armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A _fortification_ rune wards against the deadliest attacks. Each time you’re critically hit while wearing the etched armor, attempt a DC 17 flat check. On a success, it becomes a normal hit. This property thickens the armor, increasing its Bulk by 1 and the Strength required to reduce its penalties by 2.

</column>

markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 13+"
    pfs=""
>
[Winged](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2796)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 227 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This rune is a swirling glyph on the front of the armor. A large pair of transparent, ephemeral wings floats out from the back of the armor. 

**Activate—Take to the Skies** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) **Frequency** once per hour;   **Effect** You trace the rune on the front of the breastplate, and the armor’s ephemeral wings grow tangible, granting you a [fly Speed](/Rules.aspx?ID=400) of 25 feet or your land Speed, whichever is slower. This effect lasts for 5 minutes or until you [Dismiss](/Actions.aspx?ID=74) it. Once the effect ends, the wings disappear completely, reappearing in their ephemeral form 1 hour later. 

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
level="2"
right="Item 13"
pfs="Standard"
>
Winged
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 227 <sup>2.0</sup>, [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 265 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 2,500 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

<title
level="2"
right="Item 19"
pfs="Standard"
>
Winged (Greater)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 227 <sup>2.0</sup>, [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 265 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 35,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

Once activated, the wings remain tangible indefinitely. You can [Dismiss](/Actions.aspx?ID=74) the activation if you choose, and you don’t have to wait an hour to activate the rune again.
name: Winged

A large pair of transparent, ephemeral wings floats out from the back of the armor. Activate—Take to the Skies Two Actions (concentrate, manipulate) Frequency once per hour; Effect You trace the rune on the front of the breastplate, and the armor’s ephemeral wings grow tangible, granting you a fly Speed of 25 feet or your land Speed, whichever is slower. This effect lasts for 5 minutes or until you Dismiss it. Once the effect ends, the wings disappear completely, reappearing in their ephemeral form 1 hour later. <title level="2" right="Item 13" pfs="Standard" > Winged Source GM Core pg. 227 2.0 , Advanced Player's Guide pg. 265 2.0 Price 2,500 gp <title level="2" right="Item 19" pfs="Standard" > Winged (Greater) Source GM Core pg. 227 2.0 , Advanced Player's Guide pg. 265 2.0 Price 35,000 gp --- Once activated, the wings remain tangible indefinitely. You can Dismiss the activation if you choose, and you don’t have to wait an hour to activate the rune again.
description:
This rune is a swirling glyph on the front of the armor. A large pair of transparent, ephemeral wings floats out from the back of the armor. 

**Activate—Take to the Skies** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) **Frequency** once per hour;   **Effect** You trace the rune on the front of the breastplate, and the armor’s ephemeral wings grow tangible, granting you a [fly Speed](/Rules.aspx?ID=400) of 25 feet or your land Speed, whichever is slower. This effect lasts for 5 minutes or until you [Dismiss](/Actions.aspx?ID=74) it. Once the effect ends, the wings disappear completely, reappearing in their ephemeral form 1 hour later.

</column>

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 13"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Energy Adaptive](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1830)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 12 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Price** 2,600 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A complex pattern of protective symbols gives protection against various forms of energy, but only part of the runic structure can be active at a given time.

**Activate** <actions string="Reaction" /> envision;  **Frequency** once per hour; **Trigger** You take acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage;  **Effect** You gain resistance 5 to the triggering damage type. This doesn't apply to the triggering damage. This resistance lasts until you Activate this rune again or the armor is no longer invested by you.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Energy Adaptive

markdown:
**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0 **Price** 2,700 gp **Usage** etched onto a melee weapon --- An _animated weapon_ flies autonomously and strikes your foes. **Activate—Set Free** ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) **Effect** You Release the weapon and it flutters through the air, fighting on its own against the last enemy you attacked, or the nearest enemy to it if your target has been defeated. At the end of your turn each round, the weapon can [Fly](/Actions.aspx?ID=94) up to its fly Speed of 40 feet, and then can either Fly again or Strike one creature within its reach.
The weapon has a space of 5 feet, but it doesn't block or impede enemies attempting to move though that space, nor does it benefit from or provide flanking. The weapon can't move through an enemy's space. The weapon can't use reactions, and its Fly actions don't trigger reactions.
While it's activated, an _animated_ weapon makes Strikes with an attack modifier of +24 plus its item bonus to attack rolls. It uses the weapon's normal damage but has a +0 Strength modifier. The weapon's abilities that automatically trigger on a hit or critical hit still function, but the weapon can't be activated or benefit from any of your abilities while animated.
Each round, when the weapon finishes using its actions, attempt a DC 6 flat check. On a failure, the activation ends. The weapon falls to the ground and can't be Set Free again for 10 minutes.
name: Animated

markdown:
**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 239 2.0 **Price** 2,700 gp **Usage** etched onto a melee weapon --- A _spell reservoir_ rune creates a pool of eldritch energy within the etched weapon. A spellcaster can spend 1 minute to cast a spell of 3rd rank or lower into the weapon. The spell must require 2 actions or fewer to cast and must be able to target a creature other than the caster. The spell has no immediate effect—it is instead stored for later.
When you wield a _spell reservoir_ weapon, you immediately know the name and rank of the stored spell. A spell reservoir weapon found as treasure has a 50% chance of having a spell of the GM's choice stored in it. **Activate—Channeled Release** ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32)) **Requirements** A spell is stored in the weapon; **Effect** Make a Strike with the weapon. You expend the stored spell as part of this Strike; this empties the spell from the weapon and allows a spell to be cast into it again. If the Strike hits, the spell targets the target of the attack. If the spell requires a spell attack roll, the result of your attack roll with the weapon determines the degree of success of the spell, and if the spell requires a saving throw, the DC is 30. **Activate—Safe Release** ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32)) **Effect** Harmlessly expend the stored spell. This frees the weapon to have a new spell cast into it.
name: Spell Reservoir

An extending rune allows you to extend your weapon to impossible lengths. 

**Activate—Extend** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104))    **Effect** You extend your weapon, giving you an impossible reach. You Strike with the weapon, and you have reach 60 feet for the Strike.

<traits>

<column gap="tiny">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

---

The edges of a _keen_ weapon are preternaturally sharp. Attacks with this weapon are a critical hit on a 19 on the die as long as that result is a success. This property has no effect on a 19 if the result would be a failure.

[Shockwave](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2848)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=721" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

_Shockwave_ weapons magically increase their density and momentum when swung, creating a thudding impact on those nearby. Strikes with this weapon deal bludgeoning splash damage equal to the number of weapon damage dice. You're immune to this splash damage.

    right="Item 13"
    pfs="Limited"
>

</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 13 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Price** 3,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Counter-runes specific to a particular school of magic provide protections against that school. You gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws and AC against one school of magic: [abjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=2), [conjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=33), [divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47), [enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), or [transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157). The crafter chooses the school when creating the rune.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Spellbreaking

</title>

<traits>

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

_Resilient_ runes imbue armor with additional protective magic. This grants the wearer a +1 item bonus to saving throws. You can upgrade the _resilient rune_ already etched on a suit of armor using the normal process for [upgrading items and runes](/Rules.aspx?ID=3157).

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 14"
    pfs=""
>
[Cavern's Heart](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2681)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Sky King's Tomb</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=55" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #195: Heavy is the Crown](/Sources.aspx?ID=210) pg. 81

**Price** 4,100 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto medium or heavy armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Usage etched onto medium or heavy armor This armor can channel your life force into an enhanced [_wall of stone_](/Spells.aspx?ID=365).

**Activate** <actions string="Three Actions" /> command;  **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** By stamping your foot on the ground and calling out to spirits of stone, you summon a stone wall. This is a _wall of stone_, except that the wall is tied to your own life force. When the stone wall is damaged, you are damaged instead. If you are reduced to 0 HP, the wall is destroyed. The effect is dismissed if you move more than 30 feet away from the stone wall or if you spend a single action with the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) trait.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Cavern's Heart
primary_source_raw: Pathfinder #195: Heavy is the Crown pg. 81

</title>

<traits>

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 239 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

---

A _vitalizing_ weapon pulses with vital energy, dealing an extra 1d6 persistent vitality damage to undead. On a critical hit, the undead is also [enfeebled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13) 1 until the end of your next turn.

---

Shields with a _retaliation_ rune use the impact of weapons to generate blasts of explosive force that counterattack foes.

**Activate** <actions string="Free Action" /> envision;  **Frequency** once per hour; **Trigger** You [Shield Block](/Feats.aspx?ID=839) a melee Strike;  **Effect** You unleash force damage against the creature that made the triggering attack. This attack deals 4d4 force damage (DC 20 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save).

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 8+"
    pfs=""
>
[Astral](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2832)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
<trait label="Spirit" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=149" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

_Astral_ weapons command powerful spiritual energy from the Astral Plane. This rune has the same effects as a [ghost touch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=297) rune, plus Strikes with it deal an extra 1d6 spirit damage. If used to attack a creature that's possessing another creature, this weapon deals no damage to the possessed creature. On a critical hit against a creature possessing another creature, the possessing creature must succeed at a DC 26 Will save or be expelled and unable to possess a creature for 1d4 rounds.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 15"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Antimagic](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2787)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=721" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 226 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 6,500 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This intricate rune displaces spell energy, granting you a +1 status bonus to saving throws against magical effects. 

**Activate—Antimagic Armor** <actions string="Reaction" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32)) **Frequency** once per day; **Trigger** A spell targets you or includes you in its area;  **Effect** The armor attempts to counteract the triggering spell with the effect of a 7th-rank [_dispel magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=78) spell and a counteract modifier of +26.

**Craft Requirements** Supply one casting of [_dispel magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=78).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

[Corrosive](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2834)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Acid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=524" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 237 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Acid sizzles across the surface of the weapon etched with this rune. When you hit with the weapon, add 1d6 acid damage to the damage dealt. In addition, on a critical hit, the target's armor (if any) takes 3d6 acid damage (before applying Hardness); if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes this damage instead.

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 8+"
    pfs=""
>
[Decaying](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2835)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Acid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=524" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
<trait label="Void" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=510" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 237 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Eerie waves of purplish energy dance across the surface of a weapon etched with this rune. When you hit with the weapon, add 1d4 void damage to the damage dealt. In addition, on a critical hit, the target takes 2d4 [persistent void damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29); if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes the same amount of persistent damage (its wielder rolls the flat check to see if the persistent damage ends, or the GM rolls if the shield is no longer in someone's possession). Unlike normal void damage, the void damage from a decaying rune damages objects, constructs, and the like by eroding them away.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

[Advancing](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1827)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 12 <sup>1.1</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto heavy armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This rune charges up as you defeat your foes, driving you forward across the battlefield with every victory.

**Activate** <actions string="Free Action" /> command;    **Requirements** Your last action or activity reduced an enemy to 0 Hit Points; **Effect** You Stride up to 15 feet. This movement doesn't trigger reactions. You can [Burrow](/Actions.aspx?ID=93), [Climb](/Actions.aspx?ID=33), [Fly](/Actions.aspx?ID=94), or [Swim](/Actions.aspx?ID=39) instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

---

This rune attempts to obfuscate your location through illusory trickery. When you're [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4), the DC of the flat check to target you with an effect is 6 instead of 5.

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> command, envision;  **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** The armor casts [_mislead_](/Spells.aspx?ID=199), affecting you. It lasts until the end of your next turn.

markdown:
**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0 **Usage** etched onto a weapon --- Magical enhancements make this weapon strike true. Attack rolls with this weapon gain a +1 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with one property rune.
You can upgrade the _weapon potency_ rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. The Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' prices. Weapon Potency (+1) **Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 4.0 **Price** 35 gp **Craft Requirements** You are an expert in Crafting. Weapon Potency (+2) **Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 4.0 **Price** 935 gp --- The item bonus to attack rolls is +2, and the weapon can be etched with two property runes. **Craft Requirements** You are a master in Crafting. Weapon Potency (+3) **Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 4.0 **Price** 8,935 gp --- The item bonus to attack rolls is +3, and the weapon can be etched with three property runes. **Craft Requirements** You are legendary in Crafting.
name: Weapon Potency (+3)

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 6+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Swallow-Spike](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1838)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 13 <sup>1.1</sup>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) Attacks made by armor with the swallow-spike rune apply the Multiple Attack Penalty as if you had made them with another weapon._

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Your armor responds to your desire to break free of a creature grabbing you by growing spikes.

**Activate** <actions string="Reaction" /> envision ([attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15))  **Trigger** You become [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20), [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33), or otherwise held immobilized in a creature's grasp, such as by being [engulfed](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=14) or [swallowed](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=35);  **Effect** Your armor suddenly grows spikes, attacking the triggering creature. The armor makes a melee attack with an attack modifier of +14 that deals 2d6 piercing damage. If the creature is swallowing or engulfing you, the attack deals an additional 1d6 damage, and damage from this attack can cut you free if it equals or exceeds the Rupture value of the immobilizing ability. This attack gets an item bonus to the attack roll equal to the armor's item bonus to your AC and an item bonus to damage equal to double that amount.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> envision ([attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15))   **Requirements** You're being held immobilized as described in the rune's other activation; **Effect** Your armor attacks the creature immobilizing you. The armor makes a melee attack against the creature, as described in the rune's other activation.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

This attack gets an item bonus to the attack roll equal to the armor's item bonus to your AC and an item bonus to damage equal to double that amount.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> envision ([attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15))   **Requirements** You're being held immobilized as described in the rune's other activation; **Effect** Your armor attacks the creature immobilizing you. The armor makes a melee attack against the creature, as described in the rune's other activation.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 17"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Vorpal](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2853)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=683" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 239 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 15,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a slashing melee weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Originally created as a means of slaying the legendary jabberwock, _vorpal_ weapons prove equally effective against nearly any foe with a head. 

**Activate—Snicker-Snack** <actions string="Reaction" /> ([concentrate](/Actions.aspx?ID=683), [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571), [incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93))   **Trigger** You roll a natural 20 on a Strike with the weapon against a creature that has a head, critically succeed, and deal slashing damage;  **Effect** The target must succeed at a DC 37 Fortitude save or be decapitated. This kills any creature except ones that don't require a head to live. For creatures with multiple heads, this usually kills the creature only if you sever its last head.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Vorpal

Magic wards deflect attacks. Increase the armor's item bonus to AC by 1. The armor can be etched with one property rune.
