<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 12+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Brilliant](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2833)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This rune causes a weapon to transform into pure, brilliant energy. The weapon deals an additional 1d4 fire damage on a successful Strike, as well as 1d4 spirit damage to fiends and 1d4 vitality damage to undead. On a critical hit, the target must succeed at a DC 29 Fortitude save or be blinded for 1 round. 

**Activate—Shine Bright** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100))    **Effect** You plunge your weapon into darkness to return the light. Attempt a counteract check with a counteract rank of 5 and a +19 counteract modifier to end a magical darkness effect whose area is within reach of the weapon.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

</traits>

[Fortification](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2789)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 226 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto medium or heavy armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A _fortification_ rune wards against the deadliest attacks. Each time you’re critically hit while wearing the etched armor, attempt a DC 17 flat check. On a success, it becomes a normal hit. This property thickens the armor, increasing its Bulk by 1 and the Strength required to reduce its penalties by 2.

markdown:
**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0 **Usage** etched onto a weapon --- A _striking rune_ stores destructive magic in the weapon, increasing the weapon damage dice it deals to two instead of one. For instance, a _+1 striking [dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3)_ would deal 2d4 damage instead of 1d4 damage.
You can upgrade the _striking rune_ already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. The Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices. Striking **Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 4.0 **Price** 65 gp Striking (Greater) **Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 4.0 **Price** 1,065 gp --- The weapon deals three weapon damage dice. Striking (Major) **Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 236 2.0, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 4.0 **Price** 31,065 gp --- The weapon deals four weapon damage dice.
name: Striking (Major)

markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 13+"
    pfs=""
>
[Winged](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2796)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 227 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This rune is a swirling glyph on the front of the armor. A large pair of transparent, ephemeral wings floats out from the back of the armor. 

**Activate—Take to the Skies** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) **Frequency** once per hour;   **Effect** You trace the rune on the front of the breastplate, and the armor’s ephemeral wings grow tangible, granting you a [fly Speed](/Rules.aspx?ID=400) of 25 feet or your land Speed, whichever is slower. This effect lasts for 5 minutes or until you [Dismiss](/Actions.aspx?ID=74) it. Once the effect ends, the wings disappear completely, reappearing in their ephemeral form 1 hour later. 

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
level="2"
right="Item 13"
pfs="Standard"
>
Winged
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 227 <sup>2.0</sup>, [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 265 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 2,500 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

<title
level="2"
right="Item 19"
pfs="Standard"
>
Winged (Greater)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 227 <sup>2.0</sup>, [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 265 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 35,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

Once activated, the wings remain tangible indefinitely. You can [Dismiss](/Actions.aspx?ID=74) the activation if you choose, and you don’t have to wait an hour to activate the rune again.
name: Winged (Greater)

<traits>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** applied to shield

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Shields with a _retaliation_ rune use the impact of weapons to generate blasts of explosive force that counterattack foes.

**Activate** <actions string="Free Action" /> envision;  **Frequency** once per hour; **Trigger** You [Shield Block](/Feats.aspx?ID=839) a melee Strike;  **Effect** You unleash force damage against the creature that made the triggering attack. This attack deals 4d4 force damage (DC 20 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save).

</row>

---

Small roots grow along the surface of the weapon, clinging tightly to its contours. On a critical hit with the weapon, roots grow from the target. It's [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24) for 1 round ([Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) DC 23) and [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3) for as long as the immobilization lasts.

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 20"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Impossible](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1868)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 33 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Price** 70,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This rune makes a weapon capable of impossible offense and defense. The etched weapon is immune to [_dispel magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=78) and similar effects that could [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) its magic. If it's a ranged weapon or [thrown](/Traits.aspx?ID=195) weapon, its range increment is doubled.

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> command, envision ([teleportation](/Traits.aspx?ID=156)) **Frequency** once per hour;   **Effect** You and the weapon flash to a perfect attacking position, then return to where you started. Make a Strike with the etched weapon against one creature you can see, even if the target is beyond the weapon's reach or range. On this Strike, ignore any circumstance penalty, status penalty, and range increment penalty.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Impossible

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 20"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Mythic Armor Potency](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3498)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=683" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
<trait label="Mythic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=835" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [War of Immortals](/Sources.aspx?ID=232) pg. 148

**Price** 70,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This armor is etched with a mythical ward providing unparalleled defense. Increase the armor’s item bonus to AC by 4, and the armor can be etched with four [property runes](/Rules.aspx?ID=3168).

**Activate—Survive Devastation** <actions string="Reaction" /> Survive Devastation ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561))  **Trigger** An enemy critically succeeds against you with a weapon or unarmed [Strike](/Actions.aspx?ID=2306);  **Effect** Spend a [Mythic Point](/Rules.aspx?ID=3320); if the triggering Strike was made by a mythic creature, it’s a normal success instead. If it was made by a non-mythic creature, it’s a failure.

**Craft Requirements** Mythic armor potency runes can only be crafted, etched, or transferred by a mythic character  capable of making a [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) check at mythic proficiency (such as by having the Artisan’s Calling).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Mythic Armor Potency

<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 20"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Mythic Resilent](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3499)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=683" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
<trait label="Mythic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=835" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [War of Immortals](/Sources.aspx?ID=232) pg. 149

**Price** 70,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Mythic resilient runes imbue armor with unrivaled protection from a wide array of effects. The armor grants a +4 item bonus to saving throws to the wearer.

**Activate—Defy Obliteration** <actions string="Reaction" /> Defy Obliteration ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561))  **Trigger** You critically fail a saving throw;  **Effect** Spend a [Mythic Point](/Rules.aspx?ID=3320); if the triggering save was made due to an effect created by a mythic monster, hazard, or other effect, it’s a normal failure instead. If the save was made due to an effect that wasn’t mythic, it becomes a success.

**Craft Requirements** Mythic resilient runes can only be crafted, etched, or transferred by a mythic character capable of making a [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) check at mythic proficiency (such as by having the Artisan’s Calling).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Mythic Resilent

Activate—Defy Obliteration Reaction Defy Obliteration (concentrate) Trigger You critically fail a saving throw; Effect Spend a Mythic Point; if the triggering save was made due to an effect created by a mythic monster, hazard, or other effect, it’s a normal failure instead. <title
    level="1"
    right="Item 20"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Mythic Striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3500)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=683" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
<trait label="Mythic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=835" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [War of Immortals](/Sources.aspx?ID=232) pg. 149

**Price** 70,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This weapon is filled with unmatched destructive power. The weapon deals five weapon damage dice.

**Activate—Unstoppable Devastation** <actions string="Reaction" /> Unstoppable Devastation ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561))  **Trigger** You roll the weapon damage dice for a [Strike](/Actions.aspx?ID=2306) with this weapon and do not like the result;  **Effect** Spend a [Mythic Point](/Rules.aspx?ID=3320) and reroll your weapon damage dice, taking the higher of the two results.

**Craft Requirements** Mythic striking runes can only be crafted, etched, or transferred by a mythic character capable of making a [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) check at mythic proficiency (such as by having the Artisan’s Calling).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 20"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Mythic Weapon Potency](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3501)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=683" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
<trait label="Mythic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=835" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [War of Immortals](/Sources.aspx?ID=232) pg. 149

**Price** 70,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This weapon strikes with peerless accuracy to pierce the defenses of the mightiest monstrosities. Attack rolls with this weapon gain a +4 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with four [property runes](/Rules.aspx?ID=3168).

**Activate—Unerring Blow** <actions string="Reaction" /> Unerring Blow ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561))  **Trigger** You roll an attack roll to Strike with this weapon and receive a critical failure;  **Effect** Spend a [Mythic Point](/Rules.aspx?ID=3320) and reroll your attack roll with mythic proficiency, taking the higher of the two results.

**Craft Requirements** Mythic weapon potency runes can only be crafted, etched, or transferred by a mythic character capable of making a [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) check at mythic proficiency (such as by having the Artisan’s Calling).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
